ai.summary: A short, easy 0.2 km hike through Colinton Tunnel, a historic rail tunnel in the UK. The route provides a quick, accessible experience with a sheltered environment and minimal elevation change.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat, man-made tunnel interior with a concrete floor. Expect low light, cool air, and damp conditions. The surface can be slick near the ends; wear sturdy footwear and use a light source for safety.
ai.safety_notes: Verify public access and current openings for Colinton Tunnel. The tunnel can be dark and damp; bring a reliable light (headlamp or flashlight) with extra batteries. Stay on the designated path, watch your step on wet surfaces, and travel with a companion if possible. Respect any posted restrictions and exit if advised.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or hiking boots
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Phone with offline map or emergency contacts
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with the best experience in spring and summer when daylight is longer and temperatures are milder.

seo.title: Colinton Tunnel Hike — Easy 0.2 km Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Colinton Tunnel, a short and easy 0.2 km hike in the UK. Enjoy a sheltered, flat route with cool air and minimal elevation—perfect for a quick nature escape.
seo.h1: Colinton Tunnel: Easy 0.2 km Hike in the UK
